publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-111 Roseanna Cunningham: Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards—That the Parliament welcomes the inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards which will take place on 13 September 2003; notes the high calibre of nominations across all 15 categories; is confident that the existence of these awards will highlight the extent and diversity of Scottish traditional music, song, dance and languages, and looks forward to traditional music gaining a more prominent profile in the future cultural life of Scotland. Supported by: Jim Mather*, Bruce Crawford*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Alex Neil*, Mr Rob Gibson*, Ms Sandra White*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, Christine Grahame*

S2M-111 Roseanna Cunningham: Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards—That the Parliament welcomes the inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards which will take place on 13 September 2003; notes the high calibre of nominations across all 15 categories; is confident that the existence of these awards will highlight the extent and diversity of Scottish traditional music, song, dance and languages, and looks forward to traditional music gaining a more prominent profile in the future cultural life of Scotland. Supported by: Jim Mather, Bruce Crawford, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Neil, Mr Rob Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Fergus Ewing, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Fiona Hyslop, Brian Adam, Richard Lochhead, Christine Grahame, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-111 Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards (lodged on 5 June 2003) Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-111 Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards (lodged on 5 June 2003) Nora Radcliffe*, Pauline McNeill*

S2M-111 Roseanna Cunningham: Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards-That the Parliament welcomes the inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards which will take place on 13 September 2003; notes the high calibre of nominations across all 15 categories; is confident that the existence of these awards will highlight the extent and diversity of Scottish traditional music, song, dance and languages, and looks forward to traditional music gaining a more prominent profile in the future cultural life of Scotland. Note: The member who lodged this motion has provided the following translation: Duaisean Ceòl Traidiseanta na h-Alba gan toirt seachad airson a' chiad uair - Gu bheil a' Phàrlamaid a' cur fàilte air Duaisean Ceòl Traidiseanta na h-Alba a bhios gan toirt seachad airson a' chiad turais air 13 Sultain 2003; gu bheil i a' toirt fainear àrd ìre nan tagraidhean thairis air na 15 roinnean farpais; gu bheil i cinnteach gum bi na duaisean seo a' cur cudthrom air meud agus farsaingeachd ciùil, òrain, dannsa agus chànanan na h-Alba, agus gu bheil i a' dèanamh fiughair ri àite nas fhollaisiche a bhith aig cèol traidiseanta ann am beatha chultarach na h-Alba anns an àm ri teachd. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
S2M-111 Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards (lodged on 5 June 2003) Chris Ballance*, Elaine Smith*
S2M-111 Inaugural Scots Traditional Music Awards (lodged on 12 June 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Adam Ingram*
